text: Tevita Manako, also known as David Manako (born 11 November 1971) is a Tongan former rugby union player who played as centre and wing. ==Career== Manako started playing rugby for Northland in the National Provincial Championship, playing there between 1993 and 1995. This included appearing at wing for North Auckland against the 1993 British and Irish Lions, the first game of the Lions' 1993 New Zealand tour. His debut for Tonga was on 11 February 1995, against Japan, in Nagoya. He was also part of the Tonga 1995 Rugby World Cup squad, but he never played any match at the tournament. Manako's last cap for Tonga was on 3 June 2000, against Japan, in Tokyo.David Manako ESPN Scrum profile He also played for New Zealand Divisional Team in 1993 and was an All Black trialist in the same year, playing for the Possibles.David Manako at New Zealand Rugby History ==References== ==External links== *David Manako at New Zealand Rugby History * Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Tongan rugby union players Category:Rugby union centres Category:Tongan expatriates in New Zealand Category:Northland Taniwha players Category:Tonga international rugby union players
title: David Manako
